00039 #define XNARCH_DEFAULT_TICK          1000000 /* ns, i.e. 1ms */
00040 #ifdef CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC
00041 /* When the local APIC is enabled, we do not need to relay the host
00042    tick since 8254 interrupts are already flowing normally to Linux
00043    (i.e. the nucleus does not intercept them, but uses a dedicated
00044    APIC-based timer interrupt instead, i.e. RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI). */
00045 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             0
00046 #else /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */
00047 #define XNARCH_HOST_TICK             (1000000000UL/HZ)
00048 #endif /* CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC */

00052 #define xnarch_stack_size(tcb)  ((tcb)->stacksize)
00053 #define xnarch_fpu_ptr(tcb)     ((tcb)->fpup)
00054 #define xnarch_user_task(tcb)   ((tcb)->user_task)
00055 #define xnarch_user_pid(tcb)    ((tcb)->user_task->pid)

00060 struct xnthread;

00062 
00063 typedef struct xnarchtcb {      /* Per-thread arch-dependent block */
00064 
00065     /* Kernel mode side */
00066     union i387_union fpuenv __attribute__ ((aligned (16))); /* FPU backup area */
00067     unsigned stacksize;         /* Aligned size of stack (bytes) */
00068     unsigned long *stackbase;   /* Stack space */
00069     unsigned long esp;          /* Saved ESP for kernel-based threads */
00070     unsigned long eip;          /* Saved EIP for kernel-based threads */
00071 
00072     /* User mode side */
00073     struct task_struct *user_task;      /* Shadowed user-space task */
00074     struct task_struct *active_task;    /* Active user-space task */
00075 
00076     unsigned long *espp;        /* Pointer to ESP backup area (&esp or &user->thread.esp) */
00077     unsigned long *eipp;        /* Pointer to EIP backup area (&eip or &user->thread.eip) */
00078     union i387_union *fpup;     /* Pointer to the FPU backup area (&fpuenv or &user->thread.i387.f[x]save */
00079 
00080 } xnarchtcb_t;
00081 
00082 typedef struct xnarch_fltinfo {
00083 
00084     unsigned vector;
00085     long errcode;
00086     struct pt_regs *regs;
00087 
00088 } xnarch_fltinfo_t;
00089 
00090 #define xnarch_fault_trap(fi)   ((fi)->vector)
00091 #define xnarch_fault_code(fi)   ((fi)->errcode)
00092 #define xnarch_fault_pc(fi)     ((fi)->regs->eip)
00093 /* fault is caused by use FPU while FPU disabled. */
00094 #define xnarch_fault_fpu_p(fi)  ((fi)->vector == 7)
00095 /* The following predicates are only usable over a regular Linux stack
00096    context. */
00097 #define xnarch_fault_pf_p(fi)   ((fi)->vector == 14)
00098 #define xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi)   ((current->ptrace & PT_PTRACED) && \
00099                                  ((fi)->vector == 1 || (fi)->vector == 3))
00100 #define xnarch_fault_notify(fi) (!xnarch_fault_bp_p(fi))

00106 static inline void *xnarch_sysalloc (u_long bytes)
00107 
00108 {
00109     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00110         return vmalloc(bytes);
00111 
00112     return kmalloc(bytes,GFP_KERNEL);
00113 }
00114 
00115 static inline void xnarch_sysfree (void *chunk, u_long bytes)
00116 
00117 {
00118     if (bytes >= 128*1024)
00119         vfree(chunk);
00120     else
00121         kfree(chunk);
00122 }
00123 
00124 static inline int xnarch_shadow_p (xnarchtcb_t *tcb, struct task_struct *task)
00125 {
00126     return tcb->espp == &task->thread.esp; /* Sign of shadow... */
00127 }

00129 static inline void xnarch_relay_tick (void)
00130 
00131 {
00132     rthal_irq_host_pend(RTHAL_8254_IRQ);
00133 }

00141 static inline int xnarch_start_timer (unsigned long ns,
00142                                       void (*tickhandler)(void))
00143 {
00144     return rthal_timer_request(tickhandler,ns);
00145 }

00147 static inline void xnarch_leave_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00148 
00149 {
00150     rthal_declare_cpuid;
00151 
00152     rthal_load_cpuid();
00153 
00154     /* rthal_cpu_realtime is only tested for the current processor,
00155        and always inside a critical section. */
00156     __set_bit(cpuid,&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00157     /* Remember the preempted Linux task pointer. */
00158     rootcb->user_task = rootcb->active_task = rthal_current_host_task(cpuid);
00159     /* So that xnarch_save_fpu() will operate on the right FPU area. */
00160     rootcb->fpup = &rootcb->user_task->thread.i387;
00161 
00162 #if 0
00163     if(rootcb->user_task && !(rootcb->user_task->thread_info))
00164         {
00165         rthal_emergency_console();
00166         printk(KERN_ERR "RTAI[hal]: Garbaged task_struct %p (%s, pid: %d) in"
00167                " xnarch_leave_root\n",
00168                rootcb->user_task,
00169                rootcb->user_task->comm,
00170                (int) rootcb->user_task->pid);
00171         show_stack(NULL, NULL);
00172         for (;;)
00173             cpu_relax();
00174         }
00175 #endif
00176 }
00177 
00178 static inline void xnarch_enter_root (xnarchtcb_t *rootcb)
00179 {
00180     __clear_bit(xnarch_current_cpu(),&rthal_cpu_realtime);
00181 }
00182 
00183 static inline void __switch_threads(xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00184                                     xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb,
00185                                     struct task_struct *outproc,
00186                                     struct task_struct *inproc
00187                                     )
00188 {
00189 #if __GNUC__ < 3 || __GNUC__ == 3 && __GNUC_MINOR__ < 2
00190 
00191     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00192         "pushfl\n\t" \
00193         "pushl %%ecx\n\t" \
00194         "pushl %%edi\n\t" \
00195         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00196         "movl %0,%%ecx\n\t" \
00197         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00198         "movl %1,%%ecx\n\t" \
00199         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00200         "movl %2,%%ecx\n\t" \
00201         "movl %3,%%edi\n\t" \
00202         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00203         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00204         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00205         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00206         "ret\n\t" \
00207 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00208         "popl %%edi\n\t" \
00209         "popl %%ecx\n\t" \
00210         "popfl\n\t" \
00211       : /* no output */ \
00212       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00213         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00214         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00215         "m" (in_tcb->eipp), \
00216         "b" (out_tcb), \
00217         "S" (in_tcb), \
00218         "a" (outproc), \
00219         "d" (inproc));
00220 
00221 #else /* GCC version >= 3.2 */
00222 
00223     long ebx_out, ecx_out, edi_out, esi_out;
00224     
00225     __asm__ __volatile__( \
00226         "pushfl\n\t" \
00227         "pushl %%ebp\n\t" \
00228         "movl %6,%%ecx\n\t" \
00229         "movl %%esp,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00230         "movl %7,%%ecx\n\t" \
00231         "movl $1f,(%%ecx)\n\t" \
00232         "movl %8,%%ecx\n\t" \
00233         "movl %9,%%edi\n\t" \
00234         "movl (%%ecx),%%esp\n\t" \
00235         "pushl (%%edi)\n\t" \
00236         "testl %%edx,%%edx\n\t" \
00237         "jne  __switch_to\n\t" \
00238         "ret\n\t" \
00239 "1:      popl %%ebp\n\t" \
00240         "popfl\n\t" \
00241       : "=b" (ebx_out), \
00242         "=&c" (ecx_out), \
00243         "=S" (esi_out), \
00244         "=D" (edi_out), \
00245         "+a" (outproc), \
00246         "+d" (inproc) \
00247       : "m" (out_tcb->espp), \
00248         "m" (out_tcb->eipp), \
00249         "m" (in_tcb->espp), \
00250         "m" (in_tcb->eipp));
00251 
00252 #endif /* GCC version < 3.2 */
00253 }
00254 
00255 static inline void xnarch_switch_to (xnarchtcb_t *out_tcb,
00256                                      xnarchtcb_t *in_tcb)
00257 {
00258     struct task_struct *outproc = out_tcb->active_task;
00259     struct task_struct *inproc = in_tcb->user_task;
00260     unsigned long fs, gs;
00261 
00262     if (inproc && outproc->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU)
00263         /* __switch_to will try and use __unlazy_fpu, so we need to
00264            clear the ts bit. */
00265         clts();
00266     
00267     in_tcb->active_task = inproc ?: outproc;
00268 
00269     if (inproc && inproc != outproc)
00270         {
00271         struct mm_struct *oldmm = outproc->active_mm;
00272 
00273         switch_mm(oldmm,inproc->active_mm,inproc);
00274 
00275         if (!inproc->mm)
00276             enter_lazy_tlb(oldmm,inproc);
00277         }
00278 
00279     if (out_tcb->user_task) {
00280        /* Make sure that __switch_to() will always reload the correct
00281           %fs and %gs registers, even if we happen to migrate the task
00282           across domains in the meantime. */
00283         asm volatile("mov %%fs,%0":"=m" (fs));
00284         asm volatile("mov %%gs,%0":"=m" (gs));
00285     }
00286 
00287     __switch_threads(out_tcb,in_tcb,outproc,inproc);
00288 
00289     if (xnarch_shadow_p(out_tcb,outproc)) {
00290 
00291         struct thread_struct *thread = &outproc->thread;
00292 
00293         loadsegment(fs, fs);
00294         loadsegment(gs, gs);
00295 
00296         barrier();
00297 
00298         /* Eagerly reinstate the I/O bitmap of any incoming shadow
00299            thread which has previously requested I/O permissions. We
00300            don't want the unexpected latencies induced by lazy update
00301            from the GPF handler to bite shadow threads that
00302            explicitely told the kernel that they would need to perform
00303            raw I/O ops. */
00304 
00305         if (thread->io_bitmap_ptr) {
00306             struct tss_struct *tss = &per_cpu(init_tss, rthal_processor_id());
00307 
00308             if (tss->io_bitmap_base == INVALID_IO_BITMAP_OFFSET_LAZY) {
00309                 
00310                 memcpy(tss->io_bitmap, thread->io_bitmap_ptr,thread->io_bitmap_max);
00311 
00312                 if (thread->io_bitmap_max < tss->io_bitmap_max)
00313                     memset((char *) tss->io_bitmap +
00314                            thread->io_bitmap_max, 0xff,
00315                            tss->io_bitmap_max - thread->io_bitmap_max);
00316 
00317                 tss->io_bitmap_max = thread->io_bitmap_max;
00318                 tss->io_bitmap_base = IO_BITMAP_OFFSET;
00319             }
00320         }
00321     }
00322 
00323     stts();
00324 }
00325 
00326 static inline void xnarch_finalize_and_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb,
00327                                                xnarchtcb_t *next_tcb)
00328 {
00329     xnarch_switch_to(dead_tcb,next_tcb);
00330 }
00331 
00332 static inline void xnarch_finalize_no_switch (xnarchtcb_t *dead_tcb)
00333 {
00334     /* Empty */
00335 }
00336 
00337 static inline void xnarch_init_root_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00338                                          struct xnthread *thread,
00339                                          const char *name)
00340 {
00341     tcb->user_task = current;
00342     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00343     tcb->esp = 0;
00344     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00345     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00346     tcb->fpup = NULL;
00347 }
00348 
00349 asmlinkage static void xnarch_thread_redirect (struct xnthread *self,
00350                                                int imask,
00351                                                void(*entry)(void *),
00352                                                void *cookie)
00353 {
00354     /* xnpod_welcome_thread() will do clts() if needed. */
00355     stts();
00356     rthal_local_irq_restore(!!imask);
00357     xnpod_welcome_thread(self);
00358     entry(cookie);
00359     xnpod_delete_thread(self);
00360 }
00361 
00362 static inline void xnarch_init_thread (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00363                                        void (*entry)(void *),
00364                                        void *cookie,
00365                                        int imask,
00366                                        struct xnthread *thread,
00367                                        char *name)
00368 {
00369     unsigned long **psp = (unsigned long **)&tcb->esp;
00370 
00371     tcb->eip = (unsigned long)&xnarch_thread_redirect;
00372     tcb->esp = (unsigned long)tcb->stackbase;
00373     **psp = 0;  /* Commit bottom stack memory */
00374     *psp = (unsigned long *)(((unsigned long)*psp + tcb->stacksize - 0x10) & ~0xf);
00375     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)cookie;
00376     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)entry;
00377     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)imask;
00378     *--(*psp) = (unsigned long)thread;
00379     *--(*psp) = 0;
00380 }
00381 
00382 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU
00383 
00384 #if LINUX_VERSION_CODE < KERNEL_VERSION(2, 6, 11)
00385 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task)   ((task)->used_math)
00386 #define xnarch_set_fpu_init(task) ((task)->used_math = 1)
00387 #else
00388 #define xnarch_fpu_init_p(task)   tsk_used_math(task)
00389 #define xnarch_set_fpu_init(task) set_stopped_child_used_math(task)
00390 #endif
00391 
00392 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00393 
00394 {
00395     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00396     /* Initialize the FPU for a task. This must be run on behalf of the
00397        task. */
00398 
00399     __asm__ __volatile__ ("clts; fninit");
00400 
00401     if (cpu_has_xmm)
00402         {
00403         unsigned long __mxcsr = 0x1f80UL & 0xffbfUL;
00404         __asm__ __volatile__ ("ldmxcsr %0": : "m" (__mxcsr));
00405         }
00406 
00407     if(task)
00408         {
00409         /* Real-time shadow FPU initialization: tell Linux that this thread
00410           initialized its FPU hardware. The TS_USEDFPU bit is necessary for
00411           xnarch_save_fpu to save the FPU state at next switch. */
00412         xnarch_set_fpu_init(task);
00413         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00414         }   
00415 }
00416 
00417 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00418 
00419 {
00420     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00421     
00422     if(task)
00423         {
00424         if(!(task->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU))
00425             return;
00426 
00427         /* Tell Linux that we already saved the state of the FPU hardware
00428            of this task. */
00429         task->thread_info->status &= ~TS_USEDFPU;
00430         }
00431 
00432     clts();
00433     
00434     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00435         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxsave %0; fnclex" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00436     else
00437         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fnsave %0; fwait" : "=m" (*tcb->fpup));
00438 }
00439 
00440 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00441 
00442 {
00443     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00444 
00445     if (task)
00446         {
00447         if (!xnarch_fpu_init_p(task))
00448             {
00449             stts();
00450             return;     /* Uninit fpu area -- do not restore. */
00451             }
00452 
00453         /* Tell Linux that this task has altered the state of the FPU
00454            hardware. */
00455         task->thread_info->status |= TS_USEDFPU;
00456         }
00457 
00458     /* Restore the FPU hardware with valid fp registers from a
00459        user-space or kernel thread. */
00460     clts();
00461 
00462     if (cpu_has_fxsr)
00463         __asm__ __volatile__ ("fxrstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00464     else
00465         __asm__ __volatile__ ("frstor %0": /* no output */ : "m" (*tcb->fpup));
00466 }
00467 
00468 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu(xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00469 
00470 {
00471     struct task_struct *task = tcb->user_task;
00472 
00473     if(task && !(task->thread_info))
00474         {
00475         rthal_emergency_console();
00476         printk(KERN_ERR "RTAI[hal]: Garbaged task_struct %p (%s, pid: %d) in"
00477                " xnarch_enable_fpu\n", task, task->comm, (int) task->pid);
00478         show_stack(NULL, NULL);
00479         for (;;)
00480             cpu_relax();
00481         }
00482 
00483     if(task &&  !(task->thread_info->status & TS_USEDFPU))
00484         return;
00485 
00486     clts();
00487 
00488     if(!cpu_has_fxsr && tcb->user_task)
00489     /* fnsave also initializes the FPU state, so that on cpus prior to PII
00490        (i.e. without fxsr), we need to restore the saved state. */
00491         xnarch_restore_fpu(tcb);
00492 }
00493 
00494 #else /* !CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00495 
00496 static inline void xnarch_init_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00497 
00498 {}
00499 
00500 static inline void xnarch_save_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00501 
00502 {}
00503 
00504 static inline void xnarch_restore_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00505 
00506 {}
00507 
00508 static inline void xnarch_enable_fpu (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00509 
00510 {}
00511 
00512 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_FPU */
00513 
00514 #endif /* XENO_POD_MODULE */

00516 #ifdef XENO_THREAD_MODULE
00517 
00518 static inline void xnarch_init_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb)
00519 {
00520     tcb->user_task = NULL;
00521     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00522     tcb->espp = &tcb->esp;
00523     tcb->eipp = &tcb->eip;
00524     tcb->fpup = &tcb->fpuenv;
00525     /* Must be followed by xnarch_init_thread(). */
00526 }
00527 
00528 #endif /* XENO_THREAD_MODULE */
00529 
00530 #ifdef XENO_SHADOW_MODULE
00531 
00532 static inline void xnarch_init_shadow_tcb (xnarchtcb_t *tcb,
00533                                            struct xnthread *thread,
00534                                            const char *name)
00535 {
00536     struct task_struct *task = current;
00537 
00538     tcb->user_task = task;
00539     tcb->active_task = NULL;
00540     tcb->esp = 0;
00541     tcb->espp = &task->thread.esp;
00542     tcb->eipp = &task->thread.eip;
00543     tcb->fpup = &task->thread.i387;
00544 }
00545 
00546 static inline void xnarch_grab_xirqs (void (*handler)(unsigned irq))
00547 
00548 {
00549     unsigned irq;
00550 
00551     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00552         rthal_virtualize_irq(rthal_current_domain,
00553                              irq,
00554                              handler,
00555                              NULL,
00556                              IPIPE_DYNAMIC_MASK);
00557 }
00558 
00559 static inline void xnarch_lock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00560 
00561 {
00562     unsigned irq;
00563 
00564     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00565         {
00566         switch (irq)
00567             {
00568 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00569             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00570             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00571             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00572             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00573 
00574                 /* Never lock out these ones. */
00575                 continue;
00576 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00577 
00578             default:
00579 
00580                 rthal_lock_irq(ipd,cpuid,irq);
00581             }
00582         }
00583 }
00584 
00585 static inline void xnarch_unlock_xirqs (rthal_pipeline_stage_t *ipd, int cpuid)
00586 
00587 {
00588     unsigned irq;
00589 
00590     for (irq = 0; irq < IPIPE_NR_XIRQS; irq++)
00591         {
00592         switch (irq)
00593             {
00594 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00595             case RTHAL_CRITICAL_IPI:
00596             case INVALIDATE_TLB_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00597             case CALL_FUNCTION_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00598             case RESCHEDULE_VECTOR - FIRST_EXTERNAL_VECTOR:
00599 
00600                 continue;
00601 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00602 
00603             default:
00604 
00605                 rthal_unlock_irq(ipd,irq);
00606             }
00607         }
00608 }
00609 
00610 #endif /* XENO_SHADOW_MODULE */
00611 
00612 #ifdef XENO_TIMER_MODULE
00613 
00614 static inline void xnarch_program_timer_shot (unsigned long delay)
00615 {
00616     /* Even though some architectures may use a 64 bits delay here, we
00617        voluntarily limit to 32 bits, 4 billions ticks should be enough
00618        for now. Would a timer needs more, an extra call to the tick
00619        handler would simply occur after 4 billions ticks. */
00620     rthal_timer_program_shot(rthal_imuldiv(delay,RTHAL_TIMER_FREQ,RTHAL_CPU_FREQ));
00621 }
00622 
00623 static inline void xnarch_stop_timer (void)
00624 {
00625     rthal_timer_release();
00626 }
00627 
00628 static inline int xnarch_send_timer_ipi (xnarch_cpumask_t mask)
00629 {
00630 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00631     return rthal_send_ipi(RTHAL_APIC_TIMER_IPI, mask);
00632 #else /* ! CONFIG_SMP */
00633     return 0;
00634 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00635 }
00636 
00637 #endif /* XENO_TIMER_MODULE */
00638 
00639 #ifdef XENO_MAIN_MODULE
00640 
00641 #include <linux/init.h>
00642 #include <nucleus/asm/calibration.h>
00643 
00644 extern u_long nkschedlat;
00645 
00646 extern u_long nktimerlat;
00647 
00648 int xnarch_escalation_virq;
00649 
00650 int xnpod_trap_fault(xnarch_fltinfo_t *fltinfo);
00651 
00652 void xnpod_schedule_handler(void);
00653 
00654 static rthal_trap_handler_t xnarch_old_trap_handler;
00655 
00656 static int xnarch_trap_fault (unsigned event, unsigned domid, void *data)
00657 {
00658     struct pt_regs *regs = (struct pt_regs *)data;
00659     xnarch_fltinfo_t fltinfo;
00660 
00661     fltinfo.vector = event;
00662     fltinfo.errcode = regs->orig_eax;
00663     fltinfo.regs = regs;
00664 
00665     return xnpod_trap_fault(&fltinfo);
00666 }
00667 
00668 static inline unsigned long xnarch_calibrate_timer (void)
00669 
00670 {
00671 #if CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0
00672     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY) ?: 1;
00673 #else /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY unspecified. */
00674     /* Compute the time needed to program the PIT in aperiodic
00675        mode. The return value is expressed in CPU ticks. Depending on
00676        whether CONFIG_X86_LOCAL_APIC is enabled or not in the kernel
00677        configuration RTAI is compiled against,
00678        CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY will either refer to the local
00679        APIC or 8254 timer latency value. */
00680     return xnarch_ns_to_tsc(rthal_timer_calibrate()) ?: 1;
00681 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_HW_TIMER_LATENCY != 0 */
00682 }
00683 
00684 int xnarch_calibrate_sched (void)
00685 
00686 {
00687     nktimerlat = xnarch_calibrate_timer();
00688 
00689     if (!nktimerlat)
00690         return -ENODEV;
00691 
00692     nkschedlat = xnarch_ns_to_tsc(xnarch_get_sched_latency());
00693 
00694     return 0;
00695 }
00696 
00697 static inline int xnarch_init (void)
00698 
00699 {
00700     int err;
00701 
00702 #ifdef CONFIG_SMP
00703     /* The HAL layer also sets the same CPU affinity so that both
00704        modules keep their execution sequence on SMP boxen. */
00705     set_cpus_allowed(current,cpumask_of_cpu(0));
00706 #endif /* CONFIG_SMP */
00707 
00708     err = xnarch_calibrate_sched();
00709 
00710     if (err)
00711         return err;
00712 
00713     xnarch_escalation_virq = rthal_alloc_virq();
00714 
00715     if (xnarch_escalation_virq == 0)
00716         return -ENOSYS;
00717 
00718     rthal_virtualize_irq(&rthal_domain,
00719                          xnarch_escalation_virq,
00720                          (void (*)(unsigned))&xnpod_schedule_handler,
00721                          NULL,
00722                          IPIPE_HANDLE_MASK);
00723 
00724     xnarch_old_trap_handler = rthal_trap_catch(&xnarch_trap_fault);
00725 
00726 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00727     err = xnshadow_mount();
00728 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00729 
00730     if (err)
00731         {
00732         rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00733         rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00734         }
00735 
00736     return err;
00737 }
00738 
00739 static inline void xnarch_exit (void)
00740 
00741 {
00742 #ifdef CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION
00743     xnshadow_cleanup();
00744 #endif /* CONFIG_RTAI_OPT_FUSION */
00745     rthal_trap_catch(xnarch_old_trap_handler);
00746     rthal_free_virq(xnarch_escalation_virq);
00747 }
00748 
00749 #endif /* XENO_MAIN_MODULE */
00750 
00751 #ifdef __cplusplus
00752 }
00753 #endif
00754 
00755 #else /* !__KERNEL__ */
00756 
00757 #include <nucleus/system.h>
00758 #include <bits/local_lim.h>
00759 
00760 #endif /* __KERNEL__ */
00761 
00762 #endif /* !_RTAI_ASM_I386_SYSTEM_H */
